definition: to free oneself/to extricate oneself from a difficult situation
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize

sentences.english: Teacher education can not still pull itself from technical whirlpool.
sentences.chinese: 在今天，教師教育依然在技術主義的漩渦裏不可自拔。

sentences.english: Just for a laugh, and have a crush on the low memory.
sentences.chinese: 只爲一個笑，而迷戀於那卑微的回憶裏不可自拔。

sentences.english: Our eyes are naturally drawn to contrast, we simply can't help but look!
sentences.chinese: 我們的眼睛會非常自然地被對比色所吸引而不能自拔。

sentences.english: Do you sometimes feel that you are stuck in a rut?
sentences.chinese: 你是否時常感到深陷瑣事無力自拔？

sentences.english: Unable to go out because of the deep snow, she felt imprisoned in her own house.
sentences.chinese: 她因深雪而無法自拔，感覺自己被關在了屋子裏。

sentences.english: Workers are trapped in a cycle of poverty with no escape.
sentences.chinese: 工人們陷入貧困的怪圈裏，無力自拔。

sentences.english: You will only get yourself into more trouble than you can climb out of by mid-semester.
sentences.chinese: 期中後，你將只會使自己陷入更大的困境而不能自拔。

sentences.english: That he is an irrepressible jackass who thinks of himself as a sly fox?
sentences.chinese: 他是個無法自拔的混球，認爲自己是隻狡猾的狐狸？

sentences.english: Pina Gallimard reverie together, be able to extricate themselves in the one-way thinking Orientalism.
sentences.chinese: 加利馬爾遐想聯翩，無法自拔於東方主義的單向思維。

sentences.english: Only for a laugh, and caught up in the humbler memories of the misery of it.
sentences.chinese: 只爲一個笑，而陶醉於那微賤的回念裏沒有成自拔。

sentences.english: When you resist the state you’re in, you perpetuate it.
sentences.chinese: 而一旦抵制這種狀態，你會深陷其間難以自拔。

sentences.english: More than a month, I often fall into distress among the non-anonymous in order to extricate themselves.
sentences.chinese: 一個多月了，我時常陷入無名的苦惱之中無以自拔。

sentences.english: Those that sin still, must expect to be in trouble still.
sentences.chinese: 那些仍舊犯罪的人，也將仍舊在患難中難以自拔。

sentences.english: Fascination with the network all day, we will lose ourselves, unable to extricate themselves.
sentences.chinese: 整天迷戀網絡，我們會迷失自我，難以自拔。

sentences.english: Ribbing a friend for being helplessly in love.
sentences.chinese: 戀愛得無力自拔的朋友。

sentences.english: I held them closely, and now I cannot break away.
sentences.chinese: 我緊緊捧住它，如今我已無法自拔。

definition: to indulge in/to wallow/absorbed in/deeply engrossed/addicted
to be engrossed/to be absorbed with/to lose oneself in/to be addicted to
to fall deeper and deeper (in debt, in love etc)
deeply immersed/fig. wallowing in/deeply engrossed in
to sink into (vice, depravity etc)/to pass into oblivion/downfall/passing
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
to be deeply in (trouble, debt etc)/deep set (eyes)
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
to be infatuated with/to be drunk with/to be enchanted with/to revel in
